content.raw:
Can you compile the examples with the `Ignition-cmake` currently in `default`? 

When I install Ignition Transport, the main headers are installed under `<INSTALL_PREFIX>/include/ignition/transport5/ignition/transport/...` . However the log headers are installed under `<INSTALL_PREFIX>/include/ignition/transport/log/`. Note that we're losing the major version.  Then, while compiling the log examples I get the following error:


```
#!c++

[ 16%] Building CXX object CMakeFiles/example_record.dir/record.cc.o
/home/caguero/workspace/ign-transport/log/example/record.cc:25:46: fatal error: ignition/transport/log/Recorder.hh: No such file or directory
 #include <ignition/transport/log/Recorder.hh>
```

It seems that we're not installing the log headers in the extra directory with the major version.
